section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: This section provides hands‑on practice with Python variables and data types. Learners will write code to declare variables, explore primitive types, perform type conversions, and use dynamic typing features through focused exercises.
learning_objectives: Students will be able to declare variables with valid identifiers and assign initial values.
Students will be able to differentiate and use Python's primitive data types correctly.
Students will be able to convert values between data types using built‑in casting functions.
Students will be able to inspect variable types at runtime and reassign variables to different types.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to declare variables, choose valid identifiers, and assign numeric and string values.
key_topics: Assigning integer, float, and string values

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write a script that defines variables for a person's name, age, and height, then prints each variable on a separate line.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to identify and use int, float, str, and bool types correctly in simple operations.
key_topics: String type, quoting styles, and concatenation
Boolean type and truthiness in expressions

exercises.exercise_title: Create variables of each primitive type
exercises.exercise_instructions: Define one variable of type int, one of type float, one of type str, and one of type bool. Perform a basic calculation using the numeric variables and print all values.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to convert between data types using built‑in functions and handle conversion errors gracefully.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write a program that prompts the user for two numbers as strings, converts them to floats, adds them, and prints the sum. Include error handling for invalid inputs.

lessons.lesson_title: Working with Dynamic Typing and Type Checking
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to use type() and isinstance() to inspect variables and understand Python's dynamic typing by reassigning variables to different types.
key_topics: type() function to reveal a variable's class
isinstance() for type checking in conditions
Reassigning a variable to a different data type

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a variable assigned an integer value. Reassign it to a string, then to a list, printing the variable's value and its type after each reassignment.
